description: Prizes are given for physiology or medicine, physics, chemistry, economic science, literature and peace work.
title: 2022 Nobel Prizes: The Full List
title_page: 2022 Nobel Prizes: List of Winners - The New York Times
maintext:
Every year in October, committees in Sweden and Norway award six Nobel Prizes, each recognizing a groundbreaking contribution by an individual or organization in a specific field.
Prizes are given for physiology or medicine, physics, chemistry, economic science, literature and peace work. Winners receive a diploma and a medal, and each prize is also awarded 10 million Swedish krona, or about $900,000, which is divided if there are multiple winners.
During the pandemic, the Nobels made adjustments. In 2020 and 2021, some events were canceled in favor of a digital ceremony for the winners, and the Oslo ceremony for the peace prize was smaller than in most years, with a limited audience. This year, laureates will receive their Nobel Prize medals and diplomas in Stockholm in December, the organization said, and winners from the previous two years will also be invited.
